content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5009.2 - Rights of a member with a date of membership prior to July 27, 1976 who has vested

State Regulations
(a) A vested
member automatically revokes his election to vest by returning to service for
at least 20 full days in a school year. A member who revokes his vesting
election may subsequently revest. (b) A vested member may withdraw his
accumulated contributions, which will terminate his membership in this system, thereby forfeiting the right to any benefit. (c) A vested member with a date of membership
prior to July 1, 1970 may redeposit, by a single payment in the system, the sum
of any contributions formerly withdrawn therefrom or, at the time of
retirement, may purchase an additional annuity which will increase his
retirement allowance to one half of his final average salary. (d) A vested member may apply for prior
service credit and military service credit pursuant to section
243
of the

Military Law, provided all the eligibility requirements of the appropriate
provisions of law have otherwise been met. (e) A vested member may not receive a service
retirement allowance or a disability retirement allowance. (f) A vested member with less than 10 years
of credited service and his beneficiary have no right to a death benefit or a
death gamble under section
512
of the

Education Law. Upon the death of such member, the beneficiary shall receive the
member's accumulated contributions in the annuity savings fund. (g) A vested member continues to receive
regular interest on his accumulated contributions. (h) A member who has accumulated at least
five years of credited service and discontinues service on or after July 1, 1965 continues membership with the privilege of applying for a deferred
retirement benefit pursuant to section
535
(5)
of the Education Law, but in no case
prior to the date he attains age 55. (i) A member who has accumulated at least 10
years of credited service and is otherwise eligible for a deferred retirement
benefit pursuant to any provision of law shall be deemed to have filed a
vesting election when applying for a retirement benefit, if such election would
provide a better benefit. Notes
